detailed: Nancy Pelosi announces formal impeachment inquiry into Donald Trump’s alleged solicitation of Ukrainian political help to damage Joe Biden
The House of Representatives impeaches Trump (230-197), on charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress
Center for Disease Control (CDC) confirms the first case of COVID-19 in the United States
After a Senate trial, Trump is acquitted of both impeachment charges
National emergency declared over the COVID-19 pandemic

info: Trump claims mail-in ballots lead to fraud
detailed: Trump’s first public claim that use of mail-in ballots would lead to widespread electoral fraud
Minneapolis police kill George Floyd, sparking widespread protest and unrest

info: Trump refuses to commit to accepting election results
detailed: Trump refuses to commit to accepting election results
At a rally, Trump claims the Democrats are seeking to 'rig' the election

info: Trump refuses to commit to a peaceful transition of power
detailed: Trump refuses to commit to a peaceful transition of power after Election Day

info: Trump claims election win before vote count has ended
detailed: At 2am, Trump speaks from the White House as votes are being counted, saying “Frankly, we did win this election.”

info: Biden declared winner of US Election by major news networks
detailed: Most major news networks, including Associated Press and Fox News, report that Joe Biden has defeated Trump in the presidential election
Electoral college confirms Joe Biden's victory (Biden - 306 votes; Trump - 232 votes)
After speeches by Trump and Guiliani, a pro-Trump 'mob' battled police and stormed the U.S. Capitol. Five people left dead.
Electoral votes counted by Congress, confirming Biden's election victory
